thread.title: Billie Lourd feels 'blessed on the inside' in new Instagram post
thread.title_full: Billie Lourd feels 'blessed on the inside' in new Instagram post

author: USA TODAY
title: Billie Lourd feels 'blessed on the inside' in new Instagram post
text:
Billie Lourd feels 'blessed on the inside' in new Instagram post Kelly Lawler , USA TODAY 9:37 a.m. ET Feb. 7, 2017 1 Shares 
Billie Lourd, Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds in 2015. (Photo: Kevin Mazur, WireImage) 
Bille Lourd is finding the funny. 
The Scream Queens actress, 24, hasn't shared too much on her public social media accounts since the deaths of her mother, Carrie Fisher, and grandmother, Debbie Reynolds, in the same week in late December. Lourd broke her silence on Instagram after the deaths, writing, "There are no words to express how much I will miss my Abadaba and my one and only Momby. Your love and support means the world to me." Since then she's only posted on Instagram a few times. 
But on Monday Lourd posted a peaceful snap of herself out in nature, saying she was “blasé on the outside,” but “blessed on the inside.” She also included the hashtag "#findingthefunny." A photo posted by Billie Lourd (@praisethelourd) on Feb 6, 2017 at 3:18pm PST 
Lourd has mentioned "finding the funny before," including in a throwback photo with her mother in January, writing "Finding the funny might take a while but I learned from the best and her voice will forever be in my head and in my heart." Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. The world was dealt a difficult one-two punch with the death of Carrie Fisher Tuesday and her mother, Debbie Reynolds, a day later. The two had a special bond, which many watched through their public, Hollywood lives. Here Fisher kisses her mom in the photo room of the 20th Screen Actors Guild Awards in 2014. Dan MacMedan, USA TODAY Reynolds gushes with her then-husband, singer Eddie Fisher, holding their 10-week-old daughter Carrie Frances Fisher for the first family picture on Jan. 2, 1957. Associated Press Eddie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds hold their baby daughter, Carrie Frances Fisher, as they pose for a photo. Associated Press Reynolds and Eddie Fisher cuddle with four-month old Todd, left, and 19-month-old Carrie in this 1958 photo. Associated Press Reynolds holds Fisher, 2, as she visited her actress studio on Feb. 21, 1959. ASSOCIATED PRESS Reynolds is visited on the set of 'Say One For Me' by Fisher, 2, and 1-year-old Todd in this Feb. 27, 1959 photo. AP Fisher joined her mother at the opening night at the Desert Inn in Las Vegas on 28 July 1971. Jim Borrup, Handout Fisher, 15, and her mother were photographed while en route to Madrid at Heathrow Airport in London on Feb. 12, 1972. Associated Press Reynolds joined her daughter after she opened in New York in 'Censored Scenes From King Kong' on March 7, 1980. AP Fisher hugs her mom at the American Comedy Awards in 1997, where Reynolds was presented with a lifetime achievement award. Rene Macura, Associated Press Reynolds, Carrie and Todd pose during a groundbreaking ceremony at the site of the new Hollywood Motion Picture Museum on June 19, 2001 in Los Angeles. Nick Ut, AP Reynolds and Fisher in a close embrace at the Runway for Life fashion show benefitting St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital on Aug. 19, 2003. Jill Connelly, AP Fisher and Reynolds arrive for Elizabeth Taylor's 75th birthday party at the Ritz-Carlton, Lake Las Vegas on Feb. 27, 2007 in Henderson, Nev. Ethan Miller, Getty Images Three generations of the family, with Fisher's daughter Billie Lourd, right, at the Paley Center & TCM presents Debbie Reynolds' Hollywood memorabilia exhibit reception at The Paley Center for Media on June 7, 2011. Brian To More hugs at the 2011 Creative Arts Emmy Awards at Nokia Theatre L.A. Live on Sept. 10, 2011. Jason LaVeris Debbie Reynolds and her daughter Carrie Fisher died on back-to-back days. Chris Pizzello, AP Fisher presented the Life Achievement Award to her mother onstage at the 21st Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards at on Jan. 25, 2015. Kevork Djansezian Like this topic?
